plugins.name: Winding Rule Inspector
plugins.description:
Warning: If you don't know what Winding Rules are, you probably don't need this plugin.


If you want to know more about winding rules, follow this link: https://oreillymedia.github.io/Using_SVG/extras/ch06-fill-rule.html


This plugin allows designers to quickly inspect the winding rule of vector objects in Figma. It provides instant feedback about the selected vector's winding rule, helping you understand and manage the rendering behavior of complex vector shapes.


Key features:

- Automatically displays the winding rule of the selected vector object

- Updates in real-time as you select different vector objects

- Provides clear notifications for non-vector selections or when no object is selected

- Runs unobtrusively in the background, allowing you to continue your design work


How to use:

1. Run the plugin

2. Select any vector object in your Figma design

3. A notification will appear showing the winding rule of the selected vector

4. As you select different vector objects, the notification will update automatically


This tool is perfect for designers working with complex vector illustrations, icons, or any projects where precise control over vector rendering is crucial. Understanding the winding rule can help resolve unexpected rendering issues and ensure your vectors display correctly across different platforms and use cases.


Note: This plugin only works with vector objects. Selecting any other type of object will result in a notification indicating that the selected object is not a vector.

accepted.name: Thierry
accepted.description: I am Thierry ‚Äì a designer, developer, and, typographer based New York. I‚Äôve worked with companies large and small, building and maintaining design systems.

plugins.tagline: This plugin allows designers to quickly inspect the winding rule of vector objects in Figma.

plugins.name: Oz Words
plugins.description:
Introducing Oz Words, the powerful content design plugin for Figma that streamlines your workflow and simplifies your development process.


How to use


  1. Rename the layer's name of your text by starting with "#t." and then follow with words. For example, "#t.back" or "#t.page_a.title"
  2. Open Oz Words Plugin, go to the library of the language you want to edit
  3. Look for the word you want to edit in code, edit and click save
  4. After saving, your text will update automatically


Note

This is our Beta version to test our concept. Please follow us for more updates. We are working on a simpler and user-friendly version and hope it will come out soon. Cheers!
plugins.tagline: With Oz Words, you can create text as components that can be edited and updated with just one click.

plugins.name: Cloudinary Image Uploader
plugins.description:
Upload Images from Figma to Cloudinary

This tool allows you to upload images directly from Figma to Cloudinary, streamlining your workflow by eliminating the need to manually download and re-upload files.


How It Works

Cloudinary Account Setup

  1. Ensure you have an active Cloudinary account.
  2. Obtain your Cloud Name from the Cloudinary dashboard.
  3. Configure Unsigned Upload Preset:


Configure Unsigned Upload Preset:

  1. Go to your Cloudinary dashboard.
  2. Navigate to Settings > Upload.
  3. Create an unsigned upload preset and configure the desired settings (e.g., formats, transformations).
  4. Make sure to set the preset as unsigned to allow direct uploads without authentication.


Upload from Figma

  1. Use a Figma plugin or script that allows exporting images to Cloudinary.
  2. Enter your Cloud Name and unsigned preset name in the plugin/script settings.
  3. Select the images in Figma and click Upload.
plugins.tagline: Upload images directly from Figma to Cloudinary

plugins.name: Layer Name Modifier
plugins.description:
The Layer Name Modifier plugin makes it much easier to organize and manage your layer names in Figma, helping you keep your projects more organized and consistent. With this plugin, you can perform the following actions:


  1. Add a Text to Layer Names: Easily append a word of your choice to the end of layer names.
  2. Remove a Text from Layer Names: Quickly remove any unwanted word from the layer names.
  3. Remove a Text from Only the Last Words of Layer Names: Use this feature to remove a specific word only from the last words of the layer names.

This plugin is a perfect tool for organizing and standardizing layer names, especially in large projects. Save time and make your workflow more efficient!


HOW TO USE THIS PLUGIN?

Add text to layer name

  1. Select the layers you want to add t text o the layer names.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. Enter the text you want to add to the layer names into the input.
  4. When you click the Add Text button, the text you entered is added to the layer name.


Remove text from layer name

  1. Select the layers you want to remove texts from the layer names.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. Select the "Remove text" checkbox.
  4. Enter the text you want to remove from the layer names into the input.
  5. When you click the "Remove text" button, the relevant word in the selected layers is removed.
  6. If you only want to process the last words of the layer name, check the relevant checkbox.
  7. When you click the Remove Text button, the text you entered into the input is deleted if it is the last word of the layer name.
plugins.tagline: Layer Name Modifier helps organize and manage layer names in Figma, keeping projects consistent.

plugins.name: Quick Rename
plugins.description:
Automatically renames frames and components in Figma based on their auto-layout properties. It helps designers maintain consistent and meaningful layer naming conventions, making it easier to understand the structure and purpose of elements in complex designs.


Key features


  1. Renames frames with auto-layout to "Column", "Row", or "Wrap" based on their layout mode
  2. Labels frames without auto-layout as "Container"
  3. Identifies frames containing text as "Content"
  4. Rename all shapes as "Vector"
  5. Preserves naming for component instances
  6. Reset text layers names


Benefits


  1. Saves time on manual renaming
  2. Improves file organization and readability
  3. Enhances collaboration by providing clear visual hierarchy
  4. Helps maintain consistency across design systems
  5. Makes it easier to identify and update layout structures
plugins.tagline: Essential keyboard shortcut to rename layers

plugins.name: Work/Space
plugins.description:
Work/Space is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the setup of your Figma page structure with just a button click. It also includes a built-in traffic light management feature for page organisation, as demonstrated in the GIF.


Having been a developer in my past life, I can empathise with their challenges. Uncertainty about what to expect, especially when they use Figma for the first time, can delay project delivery. The inspiration for this plugin came from numerous discussions with various development teams. I realised that:


1. Developers generally don't understand Atomic Design Systems.


2. The 'Ready for dev' feature in Figma, while beneficial, isn't the most efficient way to visually communicate readiness to developers.


3. Crucially, not all development teams have access to the infamous 'Dev Mode' (a questionable decision, Figma), particularly smaller agencies or teams with limited budgets.


The traffic light system is an effective project management tool. The page management feature in Work/Space subtly encourages conversations with developers to minimise communication gaps effectively.


To make the best use of the plugin, you can set your own page structure using the source code. Contact me for more details :)


For any issues, suggestions or feedback, please reach out to me on my email hi@sai.design.

accepted.name: Sai Maniganahalli
accepted.description: I'm a multi-disciplinary designer based in Australia :)

plugins.tagline: Minimise your project setup time using Work/Space

plugins.name: Athlon TOC
plugins.description:
Navigate Your Figma Projects Like Never Before


A tool to streamline your design workflow. This powerful plugin automatically generates a detailed table of contents for your Figma files, making navigation through complex projects a breeze.


Features and Benefits:


Automatic Detection: The tool scans your Figma file and automatically identifies all sections and frames, organizing them into a clear, concise table of contents.


Clickable Links: Each entry in the table of contents is a clickable link, allowing you to jump directly to the relevant section or frame. No more scrolling through endless layers to find what you need!


Dynamic Updates: As your project evolves, rerunning the tool dynamically updates the table of contents to reflect changes, ensuring that you always have an up-to-date overview.


Vertical Auto-Layout: The table of contents is presented in a neatly organized vertical auto-layout frame, providing a clear and structured overview of your document.


Customizable Layout: While the tool takes care of the heavy lifting, you retain full control over the layout and presentation of your table of contents, ensuring it complements your design process.


Easy to Use:

Simply install the plugin, run it within your Figma file, and watch as it transforms your workflow, saving you time and effort.
plugins.tagline: Navigate with Ease: Instant Table of Contents for Your Figma Files

plugins.name: Optimize Images for Web
plugins.description:
Optimize Images for Web streamlines your entire image export workflow:


  1. Batch-optimize & export: Process every image on a page at once, then download them as a ZIP.
  2. Global compression & resize: Dial in a single set of quality and dimension settings that apply to all assets.
  3. Flexible formats: Choose PNG, WebP, or JPEG output to suit any platform or use case.
  4. Consistent renaming: Automatically rename exports in kebab-case or snake_case for tidy, predictable filenames.


With just a few clicks, you‚Äôll have web-ready images ‚Äî optimized, resized, correctly named, and packaged ‚Äî without ever leaving Figma.

plugins.name: Figma to Celtra
plugins.description:
Transform your design workflow with the "Figma to Celtra" integration! Effortlessly import your stunning Figma designs into Celtra's design workspace and unlock the power of creative automation.


Key Features:

  1. Streamlined Workflow: Continue your pre-production processes and create conceptual designs in Figma, then drop them into Celtra with ease for a cohesive and efficient design experience.
  2. Efficient Importing: Easily transition your designs from Figma to Celtra using a simple copy and paste function. Whether you're working with single layers or multiple artboards, the process is quick and hassle-free.
  3. Layer Mapping: Experience seamless compatibility as all layer types from Figma are mapped to their corresponding layers in Celtra. Make configurations effortlessly for Images, Text, Shapes, and Groups right after you import.


Once your designs are in Celtra, take advantage of creative automation to scale your content across various sizes and design variations without missing a beat. Upgrade your design collaboration and scaling capabilities today by using "Figma to Celtra", and take the first step toward a more streamlined creative workflow.


Note that this plugin is compatible only with design files created in Celtra's Creative Automation platform.
plugins.tagline: Seamless Design Integration

plugins.name: Dynamo
plugins.description:
Effortlessly increase design quality and accessibility


  1. Live preview Dynamic Type in real time
  2. Spot where text needs to wrap or truncate
  3. Add your scaled designs to the canvas with a click
  4. Saves you a ton of time


What's Dynamic Type?


Many users set a text size other than the default in order to read content more comfortably. Supporting Dynamic Type and larger text sizes is an important accessibility requirement. Dynamo scales text layers in your designs to test how they handle larger text sizes. Making it much easier to increase the quality, robustness, and inclusivity of your designs.


For best results


  1. Use auto layout in your designs so that layouts remain in tact once text layers have scaled
  2. To ignore a text layer, prepend its name with a period


Please leave comments and feedback below.

plugins.name: Mercurius - Smart Exporter for WEBP, PNG, and JPG
plugins.description:
üé® Mercurius - Smart Exporter for WEBP, PNG, and JPG


Mercurius is a Figma plugin that analyzes and exports images in multiple formats (WEBP, PNG, or JPG) with AI-generated descriptions. The plugin uses OpenAI's API to generate accurate descriptions and suggest meaningful file names while automatically optimizing file size.


Quick Export Mode üì¶

For when you just need to export images quickly with optimization


  1. Select an image, frame, or component in Figma
  2. Click "Export Image" on the home screen
  3. You'll see: selected frame name, image dimensions, aspect ratio
  4. Configure export settings: choose format (WEBP, PNG, or JPG), set maximum file size in MB, select export scale (1x, 2x, 3x, 5x)
  5. Click "Export" to save your optimized image


AI-Powered Export Mode ü§ñ

For when you want AI assistance with descriptions and smart file naming


  1. Select an image, frame, or component in Figma
  2. First-time setup: Enter your OpenAI API key: the key will be securely saved for future use
  3. Click "Analyze Image" on the home screen
  4. The AI will analyze and provide: smart image description, SEO-friendly file name suggestion, image dimensions and aspect ratio
  5. Configure export settings: choose format (WEBP, PNG, or JPG), set maximum file size in MB, select export scale (1x, 2x, 3x, 5x)
  6. Click "Export" to save your image with the AI-suggested name



Both modes feature automatic image optimization to meet your file size requirements while maintaining the best possible quality.
plugins.tagline: Smart image analysis and export for WEBP, PNG, or JPG with GPT descriptions and size optimization

plugins.name: UniBold: Unicode Page Styler
plugins.description:
Transform your Figma workspace with sophisticated typography that stands out. UniBold converts standard text into elegant mathematical sans-serif bold characters, creating visual hierarchy and professional organization throughout your design files.


Why designers love UniBold:

  1. Create instant visual distinction between sections and components
  2. Maintain consistent typographic hierarchy across all projects
  3. Improve team navigation with clearly emphasized page names
  4. Enhance presentation-ready files with polished page organization


Getting started is simple:

  1. Select the page you want to restyle
  2. Choose the style that works best for you: Uppercase, Lowercase, or preserve your original formatting
  3. Apply the new bold Unicode style to your page name with a single click


Elevate your file organization from functional to exceptional. UniBold transforms the mundane task of page naming into an opportunity for refined design thinking‚Äîbecause even the smallest details deserve attention.

accepted.description: My passions are product design, UI, and design systems...all at Emplifi

plugins.tagline: Bold your pages. Structure your designs. Simplify your workflow.
